name: Conditioner
body:
JavaScript Conditioner Framework ================================ About -------------------------------- Conditioner is a JavaScript framework to help you decouple your JavaScript UI classes from your HTML and allows you to only initialize them under on certain conditions (which is a good thing). ### Example In short it allows you to do the following: Load the Clock behavior the moment the supplied media query is met. ```html
ui.Clock is inactive
``` ```javascript var myConditioner = Conditioner.getInstance(); myConditoiner.applyBehavior(document); ``` Why -------------------------------- Most UI Classes should not be concerned with the conditions under which they are allowed to be active. For instance you might have a Map Class which generates a detailed map based on the current geolocation. Maybe, because the map takes up a lot of space, on a small screen you would rather show a url to a map service instead. The moment you add all the screen size tests to the Map Class the Map Class becomes a lot less flexible. By separating the conditions under which the Map Class becomes active you can reuse the Class under various circumstances without altering it's code.
